Exchanges compassionate looks with Jazz, indicating sincerity and some friendliness.
Yanks Zuzu by the hand and pulls her out of the house to safety during the imminent explosion.
Shows concern for The Kid after he is injured trying to stop intruders.
Tells The Kid to call the police instead of harshly reprimanding him.
Shows appreciation for The Kid's effort despite it being misguided; indicates some level of empathy and awareness.
Claims to have good leads on The Kid's missing father, showing investigative progress and confidence.
Seems unable to prevent or foresee the loss of his car despite new tires and presumably good care.
Attempts to get a ride by hitchhiking but is abandoned by the Frat Boys after a brief laugh, indicating missed social skill or poor judgment in choice of help.
Maintains composure and quickly shifts focus when help arrives in the form of Melodi.
Engages with friends in a lighthearted way despite dangerous circumstances.
Responds nonchalantly to chaotic and absurd surroundings without judgment.
Expresses detachment and resignation (e.g., 'Maybe I did die in the explosion').
Organizes the Sisters to blow out their candles and escape detection.
Escapes across the sorority lawns in a robe despite the danger.
Sets up the sports car with the emergency brake to disable the Jeep carrying enemies.
Comforts and encourages the distressed Unpoor Frat Boy by taking his hand and giving a thumbs-up with a grin.
Drops water balloons to catch and support the crumpled and bloodied Jazz.
Shows concern by immediately calling for an ambulance and stopping the music after Jazz collapses.
Steps in to comfort the Unpoor Frat Boy Driver after his car explodes, calmly extending a thumb up and grinning.
Struts confidently into the sorority with applause, initiating a playful water balloon fight to lighten mood with appropriate humor.
Responds quickly and effectively when Jazz collapses, dropping his water balloons to catch her, showing attentiveness and concern.
Shows presence of mind by instructing others to call an ambulance and get the music off, managing an emergency calmly.
Confidently insists the C.D. music is computerized and relevant, showing familiarity with the clues.
Pulls a small toy duck from his pocket and quickly discards it, demonstrating discernment in evidence evaluation.
Takes charge during computer work, directs Zuzu to put in the next disc, showing leadership and focus.
Smiles and uses facetious humor about being the best detective, indicating confidence and self-awareness.
Understands and summarizes the complicated binary disc situation with some confidence.
Decides to confront a dangerous person (Julian Grendel) directly to feel things out despite uncertainty.
Cuts off others’ objections and proceeds with his plan decisively.
Engages in casual, somewhat sarcastic conversation with Julian and Grendel, showing playful banter and familiarity.
Does not retaliate or escalate violence after being punched by Grendel, remains calm and resigned.
Allows Smiley and others to interact freely and jokes with them, demonstrating a friendly atmosphere.
Fails to prevent his prized guitar from being vandalized despite his pleas and distress.
Shows awareness of the situation and attempts to negotiate or plead, indicating some situational awareness and emotional intelligence.
Confesses he has a third disc and has taken precautions to protect it and ensure it reaches the police, showing a sense of responsibility and trustworthiness.
Smiles and tries calm negotiation despite threat, attempts humor and light social interaction by lighting a cigarette when offered.
Tosses away cigarette immediately upon being spooked, indicating sensitivity or discomfort with forced camaraderie or insincerity.
Pulls the Heavy Metal Gunslinger around the corner and incapacitates him with a brutal knee effectively.
Watches his opponent drop to the floor, showing awareness and control of the situation.
Initially tries to stop Zuzu from entering the roof access door but ultimately follows.
Quickly reacts to the locked roof door, tries to open it before the lock is shot open.
Responds to danger with a confident, if somewhat flippant, remark indicating calm under pressure.
No visible hesitation or confusion as he and Zuzu climb down and around the building ledge—indicates confidence and skill in a risky maneuver.
Encourages Zuzu despite a dangerous situation and helps her descend safely.
Calmly assesses a dangerous situation and encourages Zuzu after her accidental shooting of the Heavy Metal Gunslinger.
Helps Zuzu maneuver down the ledge and collaborates with Smiley during the descent.
Drops from above onto the ledge behind Smiley, immediately engages in physical struggle and locks hands on Smiley's neck to control the fight.
Maintains balance while struggling with Smiley on a precarious ledge/awning, fighting effectively despite dangerous conditions.
Gets head smashed against the building by Smiley but recovers by continuing to fight and maintaining grip and balance.
Falls with Smiley onto metal awning, continues to fight aggressively using punches and kicks despite unstable footing.
Lets Smiley yank his belt out, initially mocking and teasing him as a 'sissy'.
Notices Smiley's ring that matches his son's and decides he can't kill Smiley's father.
Disparages tourists rudely by telling them to 'Go back to Michigan, asswipe' and insults them further.
Immediately goes to comfort Zuzu after a frightening event and asks if she is okay.
Speaks to Jazz and Zuzu with a 'beatific smile' and tries to lighten the mood by saying 'Ladies, life's not that complicated.'
Enters the scene confidently with Jazz and Zuzu, talks casually to Don, and leads the group into the club.
Stops abruptly when Don is confused and allows Zuzu to explain, then proposes to mail a letter and move on, showing quick social awareness and control of the situation.
Offers vodka milkshakes to Sam after a violent confrontation.
Confronts Grendel about stealing from his own company, though calmly and with some humor.
Pulls five copies of the CD from his pocket after Grendel destroys the original, demonstrating preparedness and foresight.
Engages Grendel in conversation to uncover motives behind the theft, showing investigative skill and calmness.
Laughs almost fatherly at Zuzu's news about her tour and asks if she is okay, showing concern.
Bounds off stage oblivious to sprinkler system rain, indicating focus on action rather than surroundings.
Slams CDs in pocket and sarcastically says 'Happy listening' after Zuzu incapacitates Amos.
Looks confused while searching for Jazz and later shuffles away glumly after learning assistant left him calling him an asshole.
Picks up a strange sliding-arm-and-gun apparatus and manipulates the gun with a rueful smile, showing familiarity with the device.
Swiftly draws a gun and shoots Smiley before Smiley can react, showing quick reflexes and confident handling of a dangerous situation.
Expresses frustration and self-pity about the night's hardships including the loss of his guitar and a failed romantic encounter.
Acknowledges mistakes in how he treated women in the past, indicating some self-awareness but not necessarily competence in personal relationships.
Calmly thanks his arm for working after firing the gun, demonstrating a wry confidence even in a tense moment.
Owns up to being the cause of the bad news to The Kid by revealing himself as the person The Kid was asking about, implying responsibility.
Relaxing informally with friends in silly tropical shirts and identical sunglasses, displaying camaraderie and lightheartedness.
Reassuring others by clarifying that they did not harm the koala bear, showing concern and sensitivity.
